RESOLVED_ENTITIES.Maria De Jesus Garcia's pickup truck cam: Maria De Jesus Garcia's pickup truck camper

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.5th Circuit Court of Appeals: court where the appeal regarding the Allen charge is being considered and has repeatedly upheld the use of the modified Allen charge, with a panel majority attempting to apply precedents in a principled way
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Garcia: case involving the use of the Allen charge in trials and the smuggling of undocumented aliens, with jury instructions emphasizing the importance of reaching a verdict after approximately 2 hours of deliberation, now being considered by the 5th Circuit Court of Appeals
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia's pickup truck cam: vehicle suspected to contain contraband and undocumented aliens, stopped by United States Border Patrol agents on Interstate Highway 35, with its occupants attempting to hide from view
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexican border: geographic boundary relevant to smuggling, considered in determining the legality of stops by roving United States Border Patrol agents, with a distance of 115 miles from the stop location
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce standard: legal standard for evaluating the reasonableness of suspicion in investigatory stops, applied in this case to determine the lawfulness of the stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia: defendant in a trial related to illegal alien smuggling, appealing the use of the Allen charge, with her pickup truck camper being stopped by United States Border Patrol agents
